DOCNAME: BARRY and OTHERS v. THE UNITED KINGDOM
TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national who was born on DATE and who lives in ORG . He is not represented before ORG . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) are represented by their Agent , PERSON , ORG .

The applicant was widowed on DATE . There were CARDINAL children of the marriage , born on DATE and DATE . In DATE the applicant asked ORG for financial assistance in raising the children , but was refused .
The applicant remarried in DATE . On DATE , he applied for backdated widows’ benefits . On DATE he was informed that his claim had been rejected by ORG .
The applicant is a NORP national who was born on DATE and who lives in GPE , GPE . He is not represented before the ORG . The Government are again represented by PERSON .
The applicant was widowed on DATE .
On DATE he made an application for survivors’ benefits , and was informed in DATE that ORG had rejected his claim . He made a further appeal on DATE but was again rejected .

The applicant is a NORP national who was born on DATE and who lives in GPE , GPE . He is represented before the Court by PERSON , solicitors practising in GPE . The Government are again represented by PERSON .
The applicant was widowed on DATE . On DATE he made an application for survivors’ benefits , to which he received no response .
The applicant is a NORP national who was born on DATE and who lives in GPE . He is not represented before the ORG . The Government are again represented by Mr C. Whomersley .

The applicant was widowed on DATE . Shortly after his wife ’s death he asked ORG if he was entitled to benefits equivalent to those received by widows , but he was informed that he was not eligible because he was a man .
In DATE the applicant made a formal application for widows’ benefits , to be backdated to the time of his wife ’s death . The claim was finally refused by ORG on DATE .
The domestic law relevant to these applications is set out in PERSON v. the GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL-IV .
